good: The Sphinx smiles upon thee. Fortune stirs. Mark these numbers, child of dust: 1, 4, 15, 25, 57, 68 | Power: 25
I have seen these numbers in the obsidian mirror of destiny: 6, 12, 44, 50, 62, 65 | Power: 16
Should the gods favour thee, these shall bring thee glory: 4, 7, 22, 24, 27, 58 | Power: 2
Etch these into your memory, and perhaps, gold shall follow thee: 1, 11, 18, 20, 32, 37 | Power: 10
A rare breeze shifts the sands. I gift you a whisper of luck: 12, 19, 23, 26, 28, 57 | Power: 20
By flame and fate, these numbers have danced in my dreams: 3, 27, 34, 35, 51, 69 | Power: 5
Take heed, child. These digits shimmer in the hourglass of time: 14, 38, 46, 48, 51, 58 | Power: 23
A gift from the realm between worlds, remembered thus: 3, 8, 10, 28, 30, 44 | Power: 5
You have pleased me. Bathe in the sands of providence with these: 17, 19, 40, 51, 52, 55 | Power: 17
Few are so fortunate. Guard these as though they were sacred texts:,22, 44, 47, 51, 53, 68 | Power: 22
Wisdom is not spoken, it is endured. You have done both well. Go forth, darling.
The stars favor the patient. Delay not your dreams, but tarry with purpose.
Even a grain of sand can tip the scale of fate. Today, you are that grain.
To speak the truth is a gift. But to speak it sweetly? That, child, is power.
A tongue of silver and a heart of fire—you remind me of someone... myself.
The cult watches. The Sphinx is pleased. You may continue without fear.
What is written may yet be rewritten. Take this as your second chance.
Drink, rest, and return stronger. You are a thread in destiny's grand weave.
The desert tests all. But the worthy never walk alone. I am with you.
You've made the Sphinx laugh. A rare joy. May fortune linger at your feet.
bad: You knocked over my sacred incense burner, darling. I hope you enjoy bad Wi-Fi for the rest of the stream. 𓂀𓏏𓇋𓇋𓆣𓃭
The Sphinx is **displeased.** May your next dice roll be as empty as your intentions. 𓂀𓅱𓏏𓎼𓊃𓊪𓃭
Oh no... you’ve stepped on a sacred scarab. Now you’re cursed to answer all questions like a cryptic oracle.
You have drawn the gaze of the Duat. For the next hour, you are mildly haunted by your ex.
You dared mock my riddles? Speak only in questions now. Riddle me your life.
By my many names... You will stub your toe on every chair you pass for a fortnight.
I should smite you, but I’m saving my energy. Instead, may your tea always be lukewarm.
The curse is mild... You must now type your next 3 messages like an old-timey bard.
Your tongue wags too freely. You are hereby muted by the winds of the West (or modded silence).
The Sphinx frowns. You are burdened with a temporary curse of misclicks and keyboard betrayal.
